src:
Finish Urutan 26 di Etape III, Jesse Ewart Masih Sandang Yellow Jersey Tour de Singkarak
04 Nov 2019, 18:52 by Yudi Prama Agustino



Finish Urutan 26 di Etape III, Jesse Ewart Masih Sandang Yellow Jersey Tour de Singkarak



Finish Urutan 26 di Etape III, Jesse Ewart Masih Sandang Yellow Jersey Tour de Singkarak


KBRN, Padang Panjang : Pembalap atas nama Grospe Ismael Jr, berhasil menorehkan prestasi pada etape ke III iven sport tourism Tour de Singkarak (TdS) 2019, Senin 4 November 2019. Grospe Ismael, berhasil finish terdepan dengan torehan waktu 3 jam 16 menit 14 detik. 
Peringkat kedua diraih oleh pembalap asal Indonesia, Suryadi Bambang dari PGN Road Cycling Team, dengan catatan waktu yang sama. Menyusul kemudian, Kurniawan dari Banyuwangi Road Cycling Community diurutan ketiga dengan selisih waktu 4 detik.
Selain finish tercepat, Grospe Ismael Jr sekaligus mematahkan rekor Jesse Ewart, pebalap Australia dari Team Sapura Cycling yang mampu menyabet gelar juara berturut-turut di dua etape sebelumnya. 
Pada etape yang mengambil rute Kabupaten Limapuluh Kota - Kota Padang Panjang ini, Jesse Ewart tumbang. Ia hanya mampu finish pada urutan ke 26 dengan catatan waktu 3 jam 16 menit 56 detik.
Meski finish diurutan belakang, namun Jesse Ewart masih berhak mengenakan Yellow Jersey dan memimpin klasemen sementara dengan total catatan waktu 8 jam 42 menit 29 detik, selisih 1 menit 9 detik dari Raileanu Cristian, pembalap dari Team Sapura Cycling, serta tetap menjaga jarak dari pembalap asal tim Go For Gold Philippines, Grospe Ismael.
Walau harus rela melepaskan podium pertama pada etape ke III ini, namun Jesse Ewart tetap konsisten mempertahankan gelar juara untuk kategori Best Sprinter Classification, dan tetap berhak mengenakan Green Jersey. 
Hingga kini, total poin yang dibukukan oleh Jesse Ewart untuk kategori Best Sprinter Classification yakni 36 poin. Disusul oleh Bambang Suryadi dengan total 33 poin diurutan kedua, dan Grospe Ismael Jr pada urutan ketiga dengan total 23 poin.
Sementara untuk kategori Best Climber Classification, Grospe Ismael berhasil menyabet Polka Dot Jersey setelah berhasil menempati posisi pertama dengan 44 poin.
Dalam balapan yang memiliki panjang lintasan 129.9 kilometer ini, Bambang Suryadi berhasil menggeser posisi Firdaus Ahmad Yoga Ilham yang tak lain merupakan rekan setimnya dan mengunci gelar juara untuk kategori Best Indonesia Rider, yang pada etape ke II Minggu kemarin diraih oleh Firdaus.
Hingga etape ke III ini, Go For Gold Philippines bertengger diposisi pertama pada kategori Stage Team Classification dengan total catatan waktu 9 jam 49 menit 50 detik, selisih 16 detik dari PGN Road Cycling Team dan selisih 20 detik dari Banyuwangi Road Cycling Community.
Sementara untuk kategori Team general Classification by time, Team Sapura Cycling diurutan pertama dengan catatan waktu 26 jam 19 menit 36 detik. Disusul Go For Gold Philippines diurutan kedua dengan total wakti 26 jam 20 menit 5 detik dan selisih 54 detik dari PGN Road Cycling Team diurutan ketiga.
Sebelumnya, 94 pembalap yang tersisa pada etape ke III ini, dihadapi dengan medan lintasan yang cukup berat. Karakteristik lintasan yang didominasi pendakian dan tikungan yang cukup tajam, membuat para pebalap sedikit kewalahan. 
Meski harus menghadapi rintangan medan lintasan yang lebih berat, namun pada etape ke III ini, para pembalap mendapatkan, bonus untuk sejenak menyegarkan mata tanpa mengurangi konsentrasi saat balapan. 
Sejumlah spot destinasi wisata unggulan Sumatera Barat siap menyambut kedatangan pembalap dan tim official TdS 2019. Kawasan objek wisata geopark Lembah Harau, keindahan jembatan Kelok Sembilan yang mendunia, dan Mifan Water Park, beberapa dari sekian banyak spot destinasi alam yang akan memanjakan mata pembalap.
Pemerintah Provinsi Sumatera Barat, memang sengaja merekomendasikan lintasan etape per etape Tour de Singkarak dari tahun ke tahun penyelenggaraan, melewati banyak tempat objek wisata. Agar potensi kepariwisataan Ranah Minang dapat lebih terekspos dengan baik lagi di dunia internasional.
text:
Finish 26th in Stage III, Jesse Ewart Still Gird Yellow Jersey Tour de Singkarak
Nov 04 2019, 18:52 by Yudi Prama Agustino



Finish 26th in Stage III, Jesse Ewart Still Gird Yellow Jersey Tour de Singkarak



Finish 26th in Stage III, Jesse Ewart Still Gird Yellow Jersey Tour de Singkarak


KBRN, Padang Panjang: Racer on behalf of Grospe Ismael Jr., managed to carve an achievement on the third stage of the sport tourism Tour de Singkarak (TdS) 2019, Monday 4 November 2019. Grospe Ismael, managed to finish ahead with a score of 3 hours 16 minutes 14 seconds .
The second rank was won by Indonesian racer, Suryadi Bambang from PGN Road Cycling Team, with the same time record. Following then, Kurniawan from Banyuwangi Road Cycling Community was ranked third with a difference of 4 seconds.
In addition to the fastest finish, Grospe Ismael Jr. also broke the record of Jesse Ewart, an Australian rider from the Sapura Cycling Team who was able to win consecutive titles in the two previous stages.
At the stage that took the Limapuluh Kota - Kota Panjang Regency route, Jesse Ewart collapsed. He was only able to finish at number 26 with a record time of 3 hours 16 minutes 56 seconds.
Despite finishing behind, Jesse Ewart still has the right to wear the Yellow Jersey and lead the standings with a total record time of 8 hours 42 minutes 29 seconds, a difference of 1 minute 9 seconds from Raileanu Cristian, a racer from the Sapura Cycling Team, while maintaining distance from the original racer the Go For Gold Philippines team, Grospe Ismael.
Despite having to be willing to release the first podium in this stage III, Jesse Ewart still consistently defended the title for the Best Sprinter Classification category, and still has the right to wear Green Jersey.
Until now, the total points posted by Jesse Ewart for the Best Sprinter Classification category are 36 points. Followed by Bambang Suryadi with a total of 33 points in second place, and Grospe Ismael Jr. in third place with a total of 23 points.
While for the Best Climber Classification category, Grospe Ismael successfully won the Polka Dot Jersey after successfully occupying the first position with 44 points.
In the race which has a 129.9 kilometer track length, Bambang Suryadi succeeded in shifting the position of Firdaus Ahmad Yoga Ilham who was none other than his team mate and locked the title for the Best Indonesia Rider category, which in Stage II was won last Sunday by Firdaus.
Until this third stage, Go For Gold Philippines tops the first position in the Stage Team Classification category with a total record time of 9 hours 49 minutes 50 seconds, a difference of 16 seconds from the PGN Road Cycling Team and a difference of 20 seconds from the Banyuwangi Road Cycling Community.
While for the General Classification by time Team category, the Sapura Cycling Team was ranked first with a record time of 26 hours 19 minutes 36 seconds. Followed by Go For Gold Philippines came in second with a total time of 26 hours 20 minutes 5 seconds and a difference of 54 seconds from the PGN Road Cycling Team ranked third.
Previously, the 94 racers remaining in Stage III were faced with quite heavy track terrain. The characteristics of the track which is dominated by climbing and sharp turns, making the riders a little overwhelmed.
Even though they have to face heavier track terrain obstacles, in this stage III, the racers get, a bonus for a moment to refresh their eyes without reducing concentration during the race.
A number of leading tourist destinations in West Sumatra are ready to welcome the drivers and the official team of TdS 2019. The geopark tourist attraction area of the Harau Valley, the beauty of the worldwide Kelok Sembilan bridge, and Mifan Water Park, some of the many natural destination spots that will spoil the racer's eyes.
The Provincial Government of West Sumatra, indeed deliberately recommends the Tour de Singkarak stage per stage from year to year, through many tourist attractions. So that the tourism potential of the Minang realm can be better exposed again in the international world.
